result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan Earl Coleman-Wilks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other time being served with credit for 121 days.

Upon successful completion of probation, in defendant may apply for expungement.
*** 8-27-2018/Judge Glenn Yamahiro; Court ordered that the judgment of conviction shall be amended to reflect that the defendant is not statutorily eligible for expungement. ***

miscConds.notes:
The Court ordered restitution to be determined on the next Court date of 12-12-14.
***12-12-14, Parties stipulate to restitution in the amount of $2,250.00, to be paid as previously ordered by the Court. Failure to pay amount in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.***

Provide DNA sample - pay surcharge.
Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments, and costs by the end of probation period - any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment.
Pay all supervision fees.

Obtain/maintain full time employment or full time school with part time employment.
Obtain GED or HSED.
Defendant is informed he/she may not possess and/or own any firearms.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with victim Travis L.
No illegal drug dealing or association with drug community (drug users/dealers/houses)

Cooperate with all rules set forth by the probation agent.
Complete a Cognitive Thinking/Behavior Program.
Defendant is informed he/she may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been reinstated.

Obtain AODA assessment and complete follow-up care/treatment.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan Earl Coleman-Wilks

records.addlTxt: Nothing received in response to staff attorney's letter dated 8/28/18, and therefore, defendant's request for expungment is deemed abandoned at this time.
Letter to defendant.

Decision and Order Amending Judgment and Denying Request
(copy mailed to defendant)
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Glenn H. Yamahiro, Branch 34, calendar successor, for review. spc

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Jonathan Earl Coleman-Wilks in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties stipulate to restitution in the amount of $2,250.00, to be paid as previously ordered by the Court.  Failure to pay amount in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.
Justice Point report received and filed.

Defendant Jonathan Earl Coleman-Wilks in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested that the trial date be vacated and that this case case be set for plea and sentencing after the sentencing date in defendant's other felony case.  State did not object.  Court granted defense request and ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  The 11/17/14 date is vacated.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 4, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jonathan Earl Coleman-Wilks in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request another final pretrial date.  Court ordered case adjourned for final pretrial before Branch 20.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail are to continue.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, filed.
/from Justice Point, filed.

Defendant Jonathan Earl Coleman-Wilks in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel advised the Court that his client is requesting a jury trial.  The following motion deadlines were set: movant to file by 9/10/14; response due by 9/30/14; reply due by 10/07/14.  Court ordered that all motions in limine, jury instructions and witness lists to be filed within one (1) week of the final pretrial date.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

14RM039905  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
08/18/2014

Attorney Daryl A. Kastenson in court, defendant Jonathan Earl Coleman-Wilks not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  For reasons stated on the record, defense counsel requested another plea date; defendant has a pending case in Branch 15 that has a speedy trial set.  Court granted defense request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Daryl A Kastenson in court, defendant Jonathan Earl Coleman-Wilks not in court, in custody.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  OFF THE RECORD.    Defense request a plea and sentencing date.  Case is adjourned for a PLEA AND SENTENCING in branch 20.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jonathan Earl Coleman-Wilks in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Jonathan Earl Coleman-Wilks in custody.  Patricia Daugherty for Jay R Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20 due to the assignment of the Assistnat District Attorney.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jonathan Earl Coleman-Wilks in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Jonathan Earl Coleman-Wilks in custody.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
